analyzed: gtsug lag khang ngam /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsod nams las skyes par 'gyur /

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur /

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho @249a *//
translated: Please teach the divisions of the stages of accomplishing the general siddhis of these dharani mantras, by which those who practice the conduct of awakening through the approach of secret mantra will be able to please the buddhas and bodhisattvas with little difficulty,🔽and will be able to perform various miraculous feats,

original: 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs byed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du sems can thams cad sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar byed par 'gyur ba khyod kyis shod cig /
analyzed: 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs byed par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du sems can thams cad sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar byed par 'gyur ba khyod kyis shod cig /
translated: and will be able to liberate all sentient beings from all suffering in the maṇḍala assembly of all tathāgatas.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lag na rdo rjes 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lag na rdo rjes 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: Mañjuśrī, for the sake of benefiting sentient beings,

original: gzungs sngags 'di dag gi spyi'i sgrub pa'i rnam par phya ba bshad kyis nyon cig /
analyzed: gzungs sngags 'di dag gi spyi'i sgrub pa'i rnam par phya ba bshad kyis nyon cig /
translated: Listen to the general explanation of the accomplishment of these dhāraṇī-mantras.

original: 'jam dpal / de la byang chub kyi spyad pa gsang sngags kyi sgo spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang du yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de la byang chub kyi spyad pa gsang sngags kyi sgo spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang du yang rung ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this regard, a bodhisattva who practices the conduct of awakening through the gateway of secret mantra, wherever he may be,🔽should install an image of the Blessed Lady.

original: ri mo'i sku gzugs bzhag la bcom ldan 'das ma gzugs sam /
analyzed: ri mo'i sku gzugs bzhag la bcom ldan 'das ma gzugs sam /
translated: He should visualize her form,

original: kha dog gam /
analyzed: kha dog gam /
translated: her color,

original: dbyibs sam / yi ger yid la bsams te /
analyzed: dbyibs sam / yi ger yid la bsams te /
translated: her shape, or her syllables.

original: zla ba drug gi bar du bsgoms na las thams cad nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba drug gi bar du bsgoms na las thams cad nus par 'gyur te /
translated: If he meditates on her for six months, he will be able to perform all activities.

original: dug ni mthong ba tsam gyis 'bros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug ni mthong ba tsam gyis 'bros par 'gyur ro //
translated: Poisons will flee merely by his sight.

original: gdon gyis zin pa ni bsdigs pa tsam gyis 'bros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon gyis zin pa ni bsdigs pa tsam gyis 'bros par 'gyur ro //
translated: Grahas will flee merely by his threat.

original: gzhan ci yang rung bas zin pa yang mthong ba tsam gyis gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ci yang rung bas zin pa yang mthong ba tsam gyis gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever else may have possessed him will be released merely by his sight.

original: dpag tshad brgya'i pha rol na gnas pa yang las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya'i pha rol na gnas pa yang las thams cad byed do //
translated: Even if he is a hundred leagues away, he will be able to perform all activities.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad la ni lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas @249b brjod byas pa'i skud pas bsrung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad la ni lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas @249b brjod byas pa'i skud pas bsrung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: For all fears, one should make a protection cord, incanting it one hundred and eight times.

original: bgegs thams cad la ni chus srung ba byed do //
analyzed: bgegs thams cad la ni chus srung ba byed do //
translated: For all obstacles, one should make a protection with water.

original: sgrub po rnams sam /
analyzed: sgrub po rnams sam /
translated: For practitioners,

original: ro langs grub pa rnams la gzungs sngags 'di dag las gang yang rung ba gcig gis bdag bsrung ba dang / gzhan bsrung ba dang / phyogs bcing ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: ro langs grub pa rnams la gzungs sngags 'di dag las gang yang rung ba gcig gis bdag bsrung ba dang / gzhan bsrung ba dang / phyogs bcing ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams gcad par bya'o //
translated: or for those who have accomplished the vetāla, one should protect oneself, protect others, bind the directions, and establish the boundary of the maṇḍala with any of these dhāraṇī-mantras.

original: de nas lus mi snang bar byed 'dod na skar ma rgyal la ldong ros kha thabs bzhin du nyos te /
analyzed: de nas lus mi snang bar byed 'dod na skar ma rgyal la ldong ros kha thabs bzhin du nyos te /
translated: “Then, if one wishes to make one’s body invisible, one should buy realgar according to the rules on an auspicious day.

original: rang gi khrag gis bsgos la de nas phyung ste /
analyzed: rang gi khrag gis bsgos la de nas phyung ste /
translated: One should smear it with one’s own blood, and then remove it.

original: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du gzhag go /
analyzed: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du gzhag go /
translated: One should place it in front of a painted image.

original: de nas zas su 'o ma dang / phye'i 'di gu za zhing zhag bdun gyi bar du dus gsum du lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zas su 'o ma dang / phye'i 'di gu za zhing zhag bdun gyi bar du dus gsum du lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Then, eating a diet of milk and flour gruel, one should recite [the mantra] three times a day for seven days, one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la kha zas mi za bar lag pa g-yon par bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la kha zas mi za bar lag pa g-yon par bzhag ste /
translated: Then, on the eighth day of the waning fortnight, having fasted, one should place it in one’s left hand.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod byas na 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod byas na 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Reciting the Blessed One’s mantra, one will succeed.

original: thig le byas pas lus mi snang bar 'gyur zhing 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can lo lnga stong thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thig le byas pas lus mi snang bar 'gyur zhing 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can lo lnga stong thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By applying the bindu, one’s body will become invisible and one will be able to assume any form at will, and one will live for five thousand years.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mthong bar 'dod na zla ba gcig gi bar du slong mo'i zas za zhing ri'i rtse mor song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mthong bar 'dod na zla ba gcig gi bar du slong mo'i zas za zhing ri'i rtse mor song ste /
translated: If one wishes to see the Blessed One, one should eat food obtained by begging for one month and go to the peak of a mountain.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Recite the Blessed One’s mantra.

original: de nas zhag gsum smyung ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas zhag gsum smyung ba byas te /
translated: Then, having fasted for three days,

original: zla ba nya la byang chub kyi shing drung du ci 'byor pas lha bshos dbul zhing mchod pa byas te bcom ldan 'das ma la bzlas @250a *//
analyzed: zla ba nya la byang chub kyi shing drung du ci 'byor pas lha bshos dbul zhing mchod pa byas te bcom ldan 'das ma la bzlas @250a *//
translated: on the full moon day, in front of an image of the Blessed One, one should offer a pūjā with whatever one can afford, and recite the Blessed One’s mantra.

original: brjod bya'o // de nas nam phyed na bcom ldan 'das ma nyid 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod bya'o // de nas nam phyed na bcom ldan 'das ma nyid 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, at midnight, the Blessed One herself will come.

original: de la me tog dkar po dag gis mchod yon dbul lo //
analyzed: de la me tog dkar po dag gis mchod yon dbul lo //
translated: One should offer her a welcome offering of white flowers.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mas sgrub pa po'i spyi bor byugs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mas sgrub pa po'i spyi bor byugs nas /
translated: Then the Blessed Lady anoints the head of the practitioner.

original: bu legs so /
analyzed: bu legs so /
translated: “Excellent, child!🔽What supreme boon shall I grant you?”

original: khyod la mchog ci zhig sbyin par bya zhes de nyid zer ba dang / ci 'dod pa de ba slang bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyod la mchog ci zhig sbyin par bya zhes de nyid zer ba dang / ci 'dod pa de ba slang bar bya ste /
translated: Whatever is desired, that should be asked for.

original: 'dod na zho 'am /
analyzed: 'dod na zho 'am /
translated: If desired, milk,

original: rigs sngags 'chang nyid dam /
analyzed: rigs sngags 'chang nyid dam /
translated: the state of a knowledge-mantra bearer,

original: lus mi snang ba'am /
analyzed: lus mi snang ba'am /
translated: invisibility,

original: sa'i 'og tu 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: sa'i 'og tu 'gro ba 'am /
translated: traveling underground,

original: gzhan yang / yid la gang 'dod pa ci yang rung ba de thams cad bslang par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid la gang 'dod pa ci yang rung ba de thams cad bslang par bya'o //
translated: and whatever else is desired in the mind—all of that should be asked for.

original: ci ste ngang pa bsgrub par 'dod na li khri las ngang pa'i gzugs byas te /
analyzed: ci ste ngang pa bsgrub par 'dod na li khri las ngang pa'i gzugs byas te /
translated: “If one wishes to accomplish a swan, one should make the form of a swan out of vermillion.

original: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du gzhag la kunda'i me tog gis mchod pa rgyas par byas nas /
analyzed: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du gzhag la kunda'i me tog gis mchod pa rgyas par byas nas /
translated: Placing it in front of the painted image, one should make extensive offerings with kuṇḍa flowers.

original: mtshan rangs bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod byas na nang bar ram /
analyzed: mtshan rangs bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod byas na nang bar ram /
translated: Reciting the Blessed Lady all night, in the morning

original: nyi ma 'char kar 'grub par 'gyur te de la zhon nas nam mkha' la 'phags pa dang; tshangs pa gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char kar 'grub par 'gyur te de la zhon nas nam mkha' la 'phags pa dang; tshangs pa gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be accomplished. Riding on it, one will fly up into the sky and become a second Brahmā.

original: ci ste rma bya bsgrub par 'dod na 'jim pa la rma bya'i gzugs byas te /
analyzed: ci ste rma bya bsgrub par 'dod na 'jim pa la rma bya'i gzugs byas te /
translated: “Now, if one wishes to accomplish a peacock, one should make a peacock out of clay.

original: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du bzhag la /
analyzed: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du bzhag la /
translated: Placing it in front of a painting,🔽one should recite the mantra of the Blessed Lady for six months.

original: zla ba drug tu bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod byas pa'i mjug tu zla ba nya la ci 'byor bas mchod pa byas te /🔽mtshan rangs bzlas brjod byas na nyi ma 'char kar rma bya'i @250b skad 'byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu bcom ldan 'das ma bzlas brjod byas pa'i mjug tu zla ba nya la ci 'byor bas mchod pa byas te / mtshan rangs bzlas brjod byas na nyi ma 'char kar rma bya'i @250b skad 'byin par 'gyur te /
translated: At the end of the recitation, on the full moon, one should make an offering of everything one has,🔽and recite the mantra throughout the night. At sunrise, the peacock will cry out.

original: skad phyung ma thag tu sngags pas bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: skad phyung ma thag tu sngags pas bslang bar bya'o //
translated: As soon as it cries out, the practitioner should summon it.

original: de blangs pa tsam gyis sngags pa smin drug gi bu dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de blangs pa tsam gyis sngags pa smin drug gi bu dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely taking it, the practitioner will become like Skanda.

original: cho ga de bzhin du sa srung gi bu bsgrub na brgya byin dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga de bzhin du sa srung gi bu bsgrub na brgya byin dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if one accomplishes Garuḍa, one will become like Indra.

original: lus mi snang bar bsgrub par 'dod na mi'i thod ba blangs la shing mngar dang lhan cig tu zhib mor btags te /
analyzed: lus mi snang bar bsgrub par 'dod na mi'i thod ba blangs la shing mngar dang lhan cig tu zhib mor btags te /
translated: “If one wants to accomplish invisibility, one should take a human skull and mix it with sweet wood.

original: tha mar yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la aarga'i shing gi me bus la ri mo'i sku gzugs la mchod pa rgyas par byas nas mtshan rangs sbyin sreg byas te nang par de'i thal bas sen mo'i sen ris byas na lus mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha mar yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la aarga'i shing gi me bus la ri mo'i sku gzugs la mchod pa rgyas par byas nas mtshan rangs sbyin sreg byas te nang par de'i thal bas sen mo'i sen ris byas na lus mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Finally, on the eighth day of the waxing phase, one should light a fire of argha wood, make extensive offerings to the painted image, and perform the homa throughout the night. In the morning, one should scratch oneself with the ashes, and one will become invisible.

original: lus mi snang ba thams cad kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus mi snang ba thams cad kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the king of all invisible beings.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang 'byung ste /
translated: “There is also another application.

original: li khri mar dang lhan cig tu bsregs la; de nas zangs kyi snod du bzhag ste ri mo'i sku gzugs la mchod pa rgyas par byas na shel bzhin 'bar bar 'gyur gyi bar du mtshan rangs brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: li khri mar dang lhan cig tu bsregs la; de nas zangs kyi snod du bzhag ste ri mo'i sku gzugs la mchod pa rgyas par byas na shel bzhin 'bar bar 'gyur gyi bar du mtshan rangs brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should burn realgar together with ghee and then place it in a copper vessel. One should recite the mantra in front of the painted image throughout the night, making extensive offerings, until the vessel starts to glow like crystal.

original: de nas 'grub par 'gyur te des thig le byas na lus mi snang bar 'gyur te lo lnga stong thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas 'grub par 'gyur te des thig le byas na lus mi snang bar 'gyur te lo lnga stong thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when it is accomplished, one should make a tilaka with it, and one will become invisible. One will live five thousand years.

original: ci ste mig sman bsgrub par 'dod na sna ma'i me tog dang / lig bu mig blangs te zhib mor byas la de nas snga ma bzhin du zangs kyi snod du bzhag ste mchod pa byas nas zla ba gcig gi bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste mig sman bsgrub par 'dod na sna ma'i me tog dang / lig bu mig blangs te zhib mor byas la de nas snga ma bzhin du zangs kyi snod du bzhag ste mchod pa byas nas zla ba gcig gi bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings and recite the mantra for one month.

original: de nas de snga ma bzhin du @251a *//
analyzed: de nas de snga ma bzhin du @251a *//
translated: Then, as before,

original: gyur nas des mig bskus na phyogs gang du bltas pa de thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyur nas des mig bskus na phyogs gang du bltas pa de thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: one should anoint one’s eyes with it. Whoever one looks at will become enthralled.

original: ci ste des mig bskus na rgyal po dang / blon po dang / rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pa dang / rgyal po'i bu mo dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: ci ste des mig bskus na rgyal po dang / blon po dang / rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pa dang / rgyal po'i bu mo dang / gzhan yang /
translated: If one anoints one’s eyes with it, the king, the queen, the king’s daughter,

original: gang su la bltas pa de thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang su la bltas pa de thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: and whoever one looks at will all become enthralled.

original: de nas mig sman gyi mchog bsgrub par 'dod na mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la mi ro rma med pa blangs te tsandan dmar po dang ldan pa'i lha ba shos phul la /
analyzed: de nas mig sman gyi mchog bsgrub par 'dod na mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la mi ro rma med pa blangs te tsandan dmar po dang ldan pa'i lha ba shos phul la /
translated: “If one wants to perform the sādhana of the supreme eye ointment, one should procure a corpse of a person who died a natural death, and, on the eighth day of the waxing moon, offer a bali of red sandalwood.

original: de nas mi ro'i lag tu mig sman bzhag ste bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mi ro'i lag tu mig sman bzhag ste bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Then, place the eye ointment in the hand of a corpse and recite the mantra.

original: bzlas brjod byas pa dang / mi ro'i lag na mig sman 'dug pa 'gul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod byas pa dang / mi ro'i lag na mig sman 'dug pa 'gul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the recitation is finished, the eye ointment in the hand of the corpse will move.

original: de nas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, it will be accomplished.🔽If one anoints one’s eyes with it, whoever one looks at will be enthralled.

original: des mig la bskos na gnag la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro; ;sna ma'i me tog brgyad stong gi sbyin sreg byas na las thams cad bde blag tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des mig la bskos na gnag la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro; ;sna ma'i me tog brgyad stong gi sbyin sreg byas na las thams cad bde blag tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire eight thousand jasmine flowers, all activities will be accomplished with ease.

original: rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu klung gi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu klung gi nang du zhugs te /
translated: One should enter into a river that flows into the ocean.

original: mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la brtsams nas bsod snyoms kyi zas za zhing lan 'bum bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la brtsams nas bsod snyoms kyi zas za zhing lan 'bum bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: Beginning on the eighth day of the waxing phase, eating food obtained by alms, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la yang yul sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la yang yul sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the eighth day of the waxing phase, one will obtain a country.

original: yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la bsod snyoms kyi zas za zhing ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas na pha rol gyi dmag tshogs rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yar gyi ngo tshes brgyad la bsod snyoms kyi zas za zhing ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas na pha rol gyi dmag tshogs rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats food obtained by alms on the waxing eighth day and recites [the mantra] one thousand and eight times in front of a painting, the enemy army will be completely pacified.

original: de nas @251b zas su 'o ma 'thung zhing lan 'bum bzlas brjod byas na pha rol gyi dmag 'byer bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nas @251b zas su 'o ma 'thung zhing lan 'bum bzlas brjod byas na pha rol gyi dmag 'byer bar 'gyur /
translated: Then, if one drinks milk and recites [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, the enemy army will disperse.

original: mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la zhag cig smyung bar byas te /
analyzed: mar gyi ngo zhag brgyad la zhag cig smyung bar byas te /
translated: On the waning eighth day, one should fast for one day and night.

original: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du mchod pa rgyas par byas la mtshan rangs bzlas brjod byas na de nas ri mo'i sku gzugs las 'od zer 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri mo'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du mchod pa rgyas par byas la mtshan rangs bzlas brjod byas na de nas ri mo'i sku gzugs las 'od zer 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of a painting, one should make extensive offerings and recite [the mantra] all night. Then light will emerge from the painting.

original: de nas 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Then one will be successful.

original: r'a dzyam nyad  d'a ti lo lnga brgya thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: r'a dzyam nyad  d'a ti lo lnga brgya thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain a kingdom and live for five hundred years.

original: rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu klung du zhugs la lan 'bum bzlas brjod byas te zas su chu 'thungs na de nas nam mkha' la ral gri thogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu klung du zhugs la lan 'bum bzlas brjod byas te zas su chu 'thungs na de nas nam mkha' la ral gri thogs par 'gyur te /
translated: One should enter a river that flows into the ocean, recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times, and subsist on water. Then, one will be able to wield a sword in the sky.

original: des mchod yon phul la blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des mchod yon phul la blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer a libation and take it up.

original: des blangs pa tsam gyis skra lcang lor 'khyil zhing lo bcu drug lon pa'i sha tshugs dang 'dra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des blangs pa tsam gyis skra lcang lor 'khyil zhing lo bcu drug lon pa'i sha tshugs dang 'dra bar 'gyur la /
translated: By merely taking it up, one's hair will curl and one will have the form of a sixteen-year-old.

original: rig sngags 'chang du mas bskor zhing sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa mang pos rol mo byed cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang du mas bskor zhing sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa mang pos rol mo byed cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Surrounded by many vidyādhara-s, one will go forth accompanied by the music of many musical instruments.

original: nyin gcig bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ma yang mthong par 'gyur ro; ;thams cad du yang mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sprin dag grub par byed do //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ma yang mthong par 'gyur ro; ;thams cad du yang mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sprin dag grub par byed do //
translated: One will see many buddha-fields every day, and everywhere one will accomplish various kinds of offering-clouds.

original: gang gi tshe shi bar gyur pa de'i tshe yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa rnams su skye bar 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: If one offers one hundred thousand sticks of the aśoka tree into the fire, one will enthrall all four-legged beings.

original: sna ma'i me tog 'bum sbyin sreg byas na rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog 'bum sbyin sreg byas na rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers one hundred thousand jasmine flowers into the fire, one will become a trusted advisor in the royal court.

original: sna ma'i me tog 'bum sbyin sreg byas na bud med thams cad dbang du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog 'bum sbyin sreg byas na bud med thams cad dbang du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers one hundred thousand jasmine flowers into the fire, one will enthrall all women.

original: ske tshe'i sdong bu'i yam sreg shing sbrang rtsi la smyugs pa brgya sbyin sreg byas na gdon thams cad de la zhi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ske tshe'i sdong bu'i yam sreg shing sbrang rtsi la smyugs pa brgya sbyin sreg byas na gdon thams cad de la zhi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers one hundred oblations of mustard-seed sticks smeared with honey, all the grahas will be pacified.

original: 'bras kyi 'o thug dang / sbrang rtsi 'bab chu'i nang du gtor na klu mo thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur te rang rang gi gnas su yang khrid par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras kyi 'o thug dang / sbrang rtsi 'bab chu'i nang du gtor na klu mo thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur te rang rang gi gnas su yang khrid par byed do //
translated: If one offers rice-milk and honey into a stream, all the nāga women will come under one’s control and will lead one to their own abodes.

original: log 'dren bsgrub par 'dod na aa ti mukta ka'i me tog 'bum gtor na log 'dren @257b thams cad dngos grub sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: log 'dren bsgrub par 'dod na aa ti mukta ka'i me tog 'bum gtor na log 'dren @257b thams cad dngos grub sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one wishes to accomplish a marut, one should offer one hundred thousand flowers of aśoka tree. All the maruts will grant spiritual powers.

original: aa shvattha a'i lo ma sbrang rtsi la smyugs te /
analyzed: aa shvattha a'i lo ma sbrang rtsi la smyugs te /
translated: One should smear the leaves of the bodhi tree with honey and

analyzed: brgyad stong sbyin sreg byas na gnod sbyin mo thams cad sngags pa de la nyin gcig bzhin du snod gang ba ci 'dod pa 'bul lo //
translated: offer them in the fire one thousand and eight times. All the yakṣiṇīs will offer a full vessel to the reciter every day, whatever he may desire.

original: rma bya'i sgra brgyad stong sbyin sreg byas na bdud kyi gdon thams cad bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rma bya'i sgra brgyad stong sbyin sreg byas na bdud kyi gdon thams cad bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers one thousand and eight peacock feathers into the fire, all the māra grahas will be removed.

original: aa ga ru sa marda nan aasta ha sa sran dzu hu y'ad r'a dza ba sho bha ba ti /
analyzed: aa ga ru sa marda nan aasta ha sa sran dzu hu y'ad r'a dza ba sho bha ba ti /
translated: agaru, samardana, asta, hasa, sran, juhu, yad raja vashobhavati.

original: pri yang ku'i yam sreg shing gis ni /
analyzed: pri yang ku'i yam sreg shing gis ni /
translated: With sticks of priyangu wood,

original: ma h'a r'a dza gra ma hi shi ba sho bha ba ti /
analyzed: ma h'a r'a dza gra ma hi shi ba sho bha ba ti /
translated: maharaja gramahishya vashobhavati.

original: aa ga ru'i yam sreg shing gi me bus la til 'bru khri sbyin sreg byas na yul dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ga ru'i yam sreg shing gi me bus la til 'bru khri sbyin sreg byas na yul dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having kindled a fire of sticks of agaru wood, if one offers one hundred thousand sesamum seeds, one will gain control over a country.

original: shing 'o ma can gyi me bus la til 'bru 'bum sbyin sreg byas na sha za thams cad dbang du 'gyur te ci 'dod pa byed do //
analyzed: shing 'o ma can gyi me bus la til 'bru 'bum sbyin sreg byas na sha za thams cad dbang du 'gyur te ci 'dod pa byed do //
translated: Having kindled a fire of milky wood, if one offers one hundred thousand sesamum seeds, all piśācas will come under one's control and do whatever one wishes.

translated: Having kindled a fire with madhuka wood, if one offers eight thousand grains of long pepper, all bhūtas will come under one's control. Each bhūta lord will provide one hundred servants daily with food and clothing.

original: gar 'gro 'dod pa der phrag pa la bskyen te 'gro'o //
analyzed: gar 'gro 'dod pa der phrag pa la bskyen te 'gro'o //
translated: One can go wherever one wishes, carrying them on one's shoulders.

analyzed: mon sran gre'u 'bru 'bum sbyin sreg byas na 'byung mo thams cad dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: If one offers into the fire a hundred thousand beans, all the yakṣiṇīs will be brought under one’s control.

original: de dag sngags pa de'i yo byad thams cad sgrub bo //
analyzed: de dag sngags pa de'i yo byad thams cad sgrub bo //
translated: They will provide the mantrin with all the requisites.🔽“Mañjuśrī, these and other accomplishments of these dhāraṇīs will be granted wherever they are applied.

analyzed: dang; sbyor ba tha dad pa dang / sbyor ba mang yang rung / nyung yang rung bas kyang sgrub par byed do //
translated: or whether one’s application is extensive or brief.

analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, moreover,

analyzed: gzungs sngags 'di dag 'dzin pa dang / sgrub pa rnams la ni bgegs rnams kyi skabs med do //

original: lag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba las /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba las /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yum rnams kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'i cho ga rdzogs so ////

analyzed: 'phags pa lag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud chen po'i rgyal po rdzogs so ////
